intro: Dichodon alaicum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cooler, humid climates. Dichodon alaicum is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these unique ecosystems.
